text:
Hi All, I am making a Medium publication for Julia and Machine Learning and looking if anyone wants to contribute and/or if any one has any advice ? (Also I am not sure if this goes to general or random, pleae let me know and I move the post)
 <https://medium.com/mljulia|https://medium.com/mljulia>

attachments.title: MLJulia
attachments.text: Julia Programming Language and its usage mostly focused on Machine learning

elements.text: Hi All, I am making a Medium publication for Julia and Machine Learning and looking if anyone wants to contribute and/or if any one has any advice ? (Also I am not sure if this goes to general or random, pleae let me know and I move the post)

text:
Hello Farhad,
I have not read more than the title yet, and I do not think what you state is true. While some people do use Julia for ML, my guess is that the  majority of Julia users would not claim to use it for machine learning.

elements.text:
Hello Farhad,
I have not read more than the title yet, and I do not think what you state is true. While some people do use Julia for ML, my guess is that the  majority of Julia users would not claim to use it for machine learning.

text: You may want to check out the Julia users survey, some machine learning libraries are up there on top, but it wouldn't be fair to say that the usage is mostly focused on ML

elements.text: You may want to check out the Julia users survey, some machine learning libraries are up there on top, but it wouldn't be fair to say that the usage is mostly focused on ML

text: To build on Fredrik's point, I think the syntax of the tagline is a little ambiguous. You're trying to convey "Content mostly about ML with the Julia language", whereas it could be interpreted as "Content about the Julia language and how it is mostly (i.e. usually) applied to ML". I think it would be better to remove the qualifiers entirely and use something clear like "Doing ML with the Julia Programming Language".

elements.text: To build on Fredrik's point, I think the syntax of the tagline is a little ambiguous. You're trying to convey "Content mostly about ML with the Julia language", whereas it could be interpreted as "Content about the Julia language and how it is mostly (i.e. usually) applied to ML". I think it would be better to remove the qualifiers entirely and use something clear like "Doing ML with the Julia Programming Language".

text: I also second the recommendation in the other thread to avoid Medium like the plague. And please, please check with the community if you're unsure of something instead of making assumptions about e.g. what libraries are available, best practices, level of adoption/maturity etc. I've seen some rather unfortunate examples out there for Julia ML specifically.

elements.text: I also second the recommendation in the other thread to avoid Medium like the plague. And please, please check with the community if you're unsure of something instead of making assumptions about e.g. what libraries are available, best practices, level of adoption/maturity etc. I've seen some rather unfortunate examples out there for Julia ML specifically.

text:
I agree 
And I thought it could be used for bring data science subject such a statistical machine learning and linear programming and optimization to julia 
Julia is far from production level for ml but is a great tool for research in my opinion <@UJ7DVTVQ8>

Julia is far from production level for ml but is a great tool for research in my opinion

text: You may want to look through Discourse and the Julia bloggers feed. Quite a few people have talked about "traditional" stats and optimization with Julia.
